channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: When Computers Go Dark
item.description: A routine software update by a security company crashed millions of computers around the world. The chaos was telling.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Downs Hezbollah Missile Aimed at Tel Aviv
item.description: Israel said it was the first time the Lebanese militia had taken aim at Israel’s economic hub. Half a million people are displaced in Lebanon, the for...

item.title: Wizz Air proposes 300% bonus for its CEO following a ‘parade of black swans’
item.description: Jozsef Váradi's pay is a third of what it was in 2019 as the airline battles several crises.

item.title: Hezbollah Fires Toward Tel Aviv, and Iran’s New President Addresses U.N.
item.description: Plus, was your doctor’s message written by A.I.?

item.title: In Lebanon, a Family Flees Israeli Airstrikes
item.description: After years of decline, Lebanon is ill-equipped to deal with a wave of displaced people. One family left their farm and found themselves homeless in B...

item.title: 2,000 workers at Hawaii’s biggest hotel go on strike
item.description: More than 10,000 hotels workers across the U.S. went on strike on Labor Day weekend, with most ending after two or three days.

item.title: The Mushroom Kingdom That Shigeru Miyamoto Built
item.description: Decades after Miyamoto invented Mario and Zelda, he explains what makes Nintendo special and its transformation into a global entertainment brand.

item.title: Israel Says It Shot Down Missile Over Tel Aviv
item.description: The missile fired from Lebanon was the first time Hezbollah had launched an attack aimed at Tel Aviv, the military said.

item.title: American company says Mexico president expropriated its $1.9 billion crocodile-filled quarries on the Caribbean coast
item.description: U.S. quarry company said the Mexican government carried out a de facto expropriation of its properties on Mexico’s Caribbean coast.

item.title: Leadership, but No Clear Leader, Failed at Tragic Trump Rally
item.description: A Senate committee report on the Secret Service’s inability to protect the former president at a July event depicts a lack of individual responsibilit...

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot Has Become a Feminist Hero in France Amid Rape Trial
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and cour...

item.title: U.S. will now let Mexico inspect its own export avocados for pests and California growers aren’t happy
item.description: Inspectors hired by the U.S. Department of Agriculture have been threatened in Mexico for refusing to certify deceptive shipments in recent years.

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot Has Become a Feminist Hero in France Amid Rape Trial
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and cour...

item.title: Senegal’s Young President Wants a New World Order
item.description: In his first interview with Western media since becoming president of Senegal, Bassirou Diomaye Faye said the United Nations has to change to reflect ...

item.title: Kamala Harris says she will support crypto: Here are 3 steps that would show she’s serious
item.description: A law professor and digital money expert explains what it will take to persuade a skeptical crypto community that she offers a new path.
